DialogueOption.Text: I heard you delayed your launch date several times! Why’s that?

Dialogue.Page: Ah, I’m guessing you heard about this from Mica?
I hope you didn’t take too long to take off - or they’ll be telling future space cadets about how you delayed your launch for generations to come, too!
As I've told them many times.. The reason I delayed my launch date was because the Hourglass Twins' sand was flowing towards Ash Twin on the day I was setting off.
Since I was planning to explore Ash Twin on my first trip, it'd have been silly to set off while it was being buried by oceans of sand.
That’s why I opted to delay my launch, though more times than I'd have liked.. But surely I can't be blamed for that - I have no control over the universe's whims!
Still, it certainly sparked a lifelong curiosity about the Hourglass Twins. To this day, I can't help but wonder if there's more to the sand flowing back and forth than natural phenomenon.

DialogueOption.Text: The sand flows back to Ash Twin?
What made you want to explore Ash Twin?

Dialogue.Page: Well, have you seen the colossal towers of solar panels on each of the Ash Twin's poles? They are truly a magnificent sight to behold.
I first noticed them while stargazing, and wished to visit Ash Twin to get a closer look at these wondrous structures.
With solar panels of such scale, the Nomai must have been able to harness an incredible amount of energy with them! I highly recommend visiting them when you get a chance.
Fantastic view aside: you might be able to glean more about them with that new translator tool of yours. I highly recommend visiting them when you get the chance!
Oh, but do be careful! I believe my scout detected some ghost matter surrounding one of the towers during my visit. Be mindful if you visit that one.

DialogueOption.Text: I will, but tell me more about the Twins' shifting sands!

Dialogue.Page: Why, yes! Haven’t you noticed before?
Right now, sand is flowing from Ash Twin to Ember Twin - but the process eventually reverses.
In fact, if you wait, you should be able to see it beginning to flow back to Ash Twin!
Even stranger, the process seems to happen in very precise and consistent intervals.. Flowing from one twin to the other, and back again after the same length of time.
It's a mystery that has bothered me for quite some time!
But until we can find more evidence to the contrary, all we can conclude is that it seems to be a very strange natural phenomenon.

DialogueOption.Text: How long do you think it'd take for sand to start flowing back to Ash Twin again?

Dialogue.Page: Gladly!
Right now, sand is flowing from Ash Twin to Ember Twin - but did you know the process eventually reverses?
If you wait, you should be able to see it beginning to flow back to Ash Twin!
Even stranger, the process seems to happen in very precise and consistent intervals.. Flowing from one twin to the other, and back again after the same length of time.
It's a mystery that has bothered me for quite some time!
But until we can find more evidence to the contrary, all we can conclude is that it seems to be a very strange natural phenomenon.

DialogueOption.Text: How long do you think it'd take for sand to start flowing back to Ash Twin again?

Dialogue.Page: Hm... It will take a while longer, I believe.
Come back once more of the sand has drained off from Ash Twin, and I might be able to give you a more precise answer then!
If you’re feeling impatient, feel free to take a nap by a campfire to pass the time.
I set up this camp here to avoid the sand column's path - so please, put away any worry about the sand column wandering this way while you rest.

DialogueOption.Text: Cool, cool. Tell me about what you found on Ash Twin, though!

Dialogue.Page: Goodness! That's right, that's what we were discussing at first, wasn't it? My apologies for rambling!
Well, have you seen the colossal towers of solar panels on each of the Ash Twin's poles? They are truly a magnificent sight to behold.
I first noticed them while stargazing, and wished to visit Ash Twin to get a closer look at these wondrous structures.
With solar panels of such scale, the Nomai must have been able to harness an incredible amount of energy with them! I highly recommend visiting them when you get a chance.
Fantastic view aside: you might be able to glean more about them with that new translator tool of yours! I highly recommend visiting them when you get the chance.
Oh, but do be careful! I believe my scout detected some ghost matter surrounding one of the towers during my visit. Be mindful if you visit that one.

DialogueOption.Text: I will, but tell me more about the Twins' shifting sands!
I found out what causes the sand to flow between the twins.

Dialogue.Page: How fascinating..
So if I understand correctly.. Gravity from the sun and the twin closer to the sun cause a combined force that pulls sand to the other twin when the twins orbit into alignment?
It sounds peculiar.. but it makes complete sense now that you've spelled it out!

Surely, the gravitational centre of the solar system combining its pull with another planet would cause some interesting tidal effects. And you said the Nomai called this phenomenon the "sunless day"?
Excellent work, hatchling. Solving a mystery that has puzzled me for ages on your first expedition is truly something else!
After we gather more conclusive data on this phenomenon, we should mark your findings with a new exhibit in the village museum, then celebrate with some sap wine!
